DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis : What best modulation pulse frequency transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation dysmenorrhea ? Purpose : To determine effect hypoalgesia frequency modulation pulse transcutaneous electrical nerve ( TENS ) dysmenorrhea . Methods : A controlled clinical study prospective develop School Physiotherapy Clinic / UFPI . Forty student randomize four distinct group modulation frequency TENS : group 1 - 100 Hz , 100μs , group 2 - 4 Hz , 100μs , group 3 - placebo ( apparatus ) , group 4 - placebo induce ( 2 Hz , 40μs ) . All initially evaluate questionnaire developed study , visual analogue scale ( VAS ) ( , 20 , 30 , 40 , 50 , 60 minute ) McGill Pain Questionnaire ( 20 minute ) . The total duration TENS application 20 minute protocol perform single session . The analysis variance ( One-way ANOVA ) follow Tukey procedure apply identify difference experimental group variable analyze . The level significance p < 0,05 .
